page.title: 08The old Railway-Welshampton
page.content: Cambrian railways built the railway which used to run between Whitchurch, Oswestry and Aberystwyth,some of the railway line is still used today.The line was built in approximately 1880. It was used for passengers,freight and also to carry troops in the Second World War.The old station is now a house.The line was closed in 1966,a man called Dr Beeching and the Government closed it because it wasn't making enough money.The old sleepers went for timber but some are still there today.The rails went for scrap.The line is now a haven for wildlife.Birds nest there,there are many species of wild flowers,but some of it is used for rough grazing.It now looks much as it did when it was a Roman road.There was a very serious crash on the line in 1909 near Welshampton station.
